intro: Adenocalymma involucratum, commonly known as the silky burr, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. Adenocalymma involucratum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
